New Records: Nedim Bajrami scored the fastest goal in European Championship history, taking just 23 seconds.
Key Match Events: Kramaric scored for Croatia in the 74th minute.
Gjasula scored an own goal in the 76th minute.
Ivusic scored for Croatia in the 87th minute.
Laci scored for Albania in the 11th minute.
Gjasula scored for Albania in the 90+5th minute.
Hysaj received a yellow card in the 77th minute.
Daku received a yellow card in the 90+4th minute.
Gjasula received a yellow card in the 90+7th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Albania cannot afford to lose again as it would almost certainly mean elimination.
Sylvinho is considering making changes to the XI that lined up against Italy.
Jasir Asani has recovered from an ankle injury and may start.
Arber Hoxha, who plays for Dinamo Zagreb, could be called upon.
Ernest Muci is another contender for the lineup.
Rey Manaj is vying for promotion from the bench after Armando Broja's lackluster performance against Italy.
Nedim Bajrami, who scored the fastest goal in European Championship history, is expected to start.
